title: Xetex pdf
body:
This solves a recent build error relating to unicode in the documentation.
`03:57:57  Underfull \hbox (badness 10000) in paragraph at lines 545--548
03:57:57  []\T1/ptm/m/n/10 Generate sign-up data: $\OT1/cmr/m/n/10 (\OML/cmm/m/it/10 PPK;
03:57:57   report; PSEmanifest; sealedSignUpData\OT1/cmr/m/n/10 ) =
03:57:57  [6] [7] [8] [9]
03:57:57  
03:57:57  ! Package inputenc Error: Unicode char Ïƒ (U+3C3)
03:57:57  (inputenc)                not set up for use with LaTeX.`

The error started after a upgrade to Sphinx 2.0.0 from 1.8.5

title: Add COMPOSE_PROJECT_NAME to Jenkinsfile
body:
This variable prevents naming collisions in containers created by
docker-compose. This variable was missing from the Jenkinsfile rewrite.

Signed-off-by: Richard Berg <rberg@bitwise.io>

body: Signed-off-by: Richard Berg <rberg@bitwise.io>

body: Signed-off-by: Richard Berg <rberg@bitwise.io>

title: Rust validator registry tp initial commits
body:
This rust validator registry tp replaces the python validator registry tp.

Also, rebasing commits from master to poet2 branch.

title: POET2 SGX Enclave code (trusted) and bridge (untrusted)
body:
- Removed platform service enclave(PSE) dependencies and monotonic counter
  to support POET on IA based platforms where PSE is not available

- Removed SGX seal/unseal functionality

- Replaced CreateWaitTimer/CreateWaitCertificate functions which uses
  SGX trusted time with InitializeWaitCerificate/FinalizeWaitCertificate

Signed-off-by: Manoj Gopalakrishnan <manoj.gopalakrishnan@intel.com>

title: Make engine ignore peer notification messages
body:
PoET does not need to react to its validator's peering events.
Gracefully handle those notifications by ignoring them rather than
logging an error.

Signed-off-by: Dan Middleton <dan.middleton@intel.com>

title: Remove windows make file from docs
body: Signed-off-by: Dan Middleton <dan.middleton@intel.com>

title: Initial commit for POET2
body:
This PR has multiple commits
1. Removing files from existing repo which will be superseded by POET2 directory
2. POET2 Engine and Service implementation based on Sawtooth consensus SDK
3. POET2 SGX Enclave code (trusted) and bridge (untrusted)
4. Rust-SGX C++ bridge layer and corresponding Rust FFI layer
5. C++ unit test cases for SGX enclave
6. Validatory registry TP for POET implemented in Rust
7. Docker compose files and debian package files
8. IAS client and proxy implementation in Rust
9. Enabled clippy error and rustfmt checks in Jenkins build.

Signed-off-by: Manoj Gopalakrishnan <manoj.gopalakrishnan@intel.com>

title: Split PoET off into separate repo from Sawtooth Core
body: This commit sets up the Sawtooth PoET repo by reorganizing the Sawtooth Core repo post `git filter-branch --subdirectory-filter consensus/poet`.
